meanings.definition: A dislike or distrust of humankind.
meanings.sent1: Her misanthropy made it hard for her to make friends.
meanings.sent2: His misanthropy grew as he experienced more disappointments.
meanings.sent3: Despite his misanthropy, he still enjoyed spending time with his dog.
meanings.sent4: The shadow of misanthropy followed her wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The misanthropy in his eyes was unmistakable.

meanings.definition: A general hatred or distrust of people.
meanings.sent1: The misanthropy in his heart poisoned his relationships.
meanings.sent2: Her misanthropy towards strangers was evident in her cold demeanor.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show portrayed a world ruled by misanthropy.
meanings.sent4: The artist's painting captured the essence of misanthropy in society.
meanings.sent5: The misanthropy in the air was palpable during the heated debate.
